Fo' real. -- don't add whipped cream or make it "soy" cos otherwise it'll be sugar-overload insanity - I think it was purrfect as is, as was, and as it always will be -- cos they always get it right.

I don't like admitting to their goodness.  It bites me.  
So I hover in limbo at 3 stars.  Voila.
author: Anjali V.

description:
It is great... GREAT people, open earlier than ANYTHING NEARBY by two hours..  

It got popular for a reason.. the coffee is fine.

It is good, and if the Beanery, Alvin's, or Kaleo is closed, this is a perfect spot for coffee.  Would love to give it four stars, but I just can't.

If it is normal hours, hit the local mom and pops.  Up at 4:30am?  Sucks to be you... but you are set for Starbucks!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: I never had a problem with starbucks. And yesterday this super talkative dude made my most favorite drink ever. He had to remember how to make it but he did it. So props to him. The situation was funny.
author: Julie Z.

description:
came into today, no line. i hate the long lines at any starbucks downtown.

grande caramel frap w/ whip cream please

while i was walking home and drinking my frap, i realized i forgot to order decaf...i hope i'll be able to sleep tonight.

oh yeah, this is the starbucks that doesn't have internet, or...at least the last time a laptop was brought, it didn't work...another starbucks (the one on irving & 19th) has internet. i think if you have a registered starbucks giftcard, you can go online for 2 hours each day...

i like how this starbucks is spacious inside and they have outdoor seating. it was a nice day today and all the seats inside were taken, so we sat outside.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Good old reliable, I know what to expect here.  

After another experience with a small coffee place in Hayes Valley that made me a machiato without any caramel, I ran to this location to get what I had been craving all morning.  

Yummy, they always do it right here.  I know corporate greed, chain, puts out the small mom and pop shop, and all that.  But really, on a Sunday morning, I just want what I want the way I want it.  And Starbucks delivers every single time, hands down.  I have never been to a Starbucks where my drink wasn't what I expected, that is the beauty of a chain.  I can get the same drink at any location.  And sometimes that is all I care about.
author: Denise B.

description:
in general this is an awesome place to go if you want to study or just hang out with friends but there is one major thing that i absolutely don't like about this place.  There's this one employee, i think she's the assistant manager or something - she's one downfall.  Whenever and i mean literally everytime she makes a drink for us, first - all the drinks no matter what they are literally taste exactly the same, you're paying $3.85 to basically drink expresso and hot milk only even though you ordered a caramel macchiato or a cappucino or americano...there literally is no difference.  I understand the budget and economy is tight and you gotta cut back on ingredients but dang, you don't have to be this cheap that you don't get any kind of flavors.  Speaking of flavors, the second point is, i don't know why whenever she makes the drinks, not only do her drinks taste the same but they also taste "rotten" as if she's making her drinks with expired milk - it's fuckin disgusting!!  My friends and I always wait till somebody else takes over the drinks department so we can get our money's worth.

So, if you ever plan on going to this starubucks and you order a drink, make sure this girl isn't the one making your drink.  She has dark brown hair, wears glasses and the biggest observation  - she's always wearing a tie.  She usually wears a black tie but a couple days ago she wore a green tie.  It's a tie nonetheless!  Just warning you guys.  Other than that, all the staff members are awesome and they make my trip to starbucks worthwhile and their drinks actually taste like what you ordered and something a person wouldn't even give their dogs.
author: Me V.

description:
It's just another Starbucks with the standard menu, furniture, and background music.  Oh, they didn't play Nora Jones here.  I used the washroom here and was surprised that it was quite clean.  

Service was rather mediocre, especially since I was told the washroom key was taken and it was actually sitting at a different part of the counter.  I waited for a little but but decided to confirm again with her that they really didn't have the key.  It was then that she said, "Actually, the key's right there...I just didn't see it."  OK, maybe you're busy or preoccupied with making someone else's drink but you should at least have the decency to see if I was still waiting for the washroom when you realized the key was at the counter!  Thanks, lady!

Anyways, this is a pretty busy Starbucks with the tables pretty much 90% occupied and a relatively low turnover rate.  Most tables were occupied by students studying because you see a number of open textbooks, highlighters, and notes.  

I also spotted some interesting things happening around here.  People would walk in with a box of take-out from a nearby restaurant, buy a coffee/tea, and then proceed to finish their meal at Starbucks.  I saw someone with food from a Chinese restaurant and another person with a box of pizza!  It almost felt like I was in a food court...except everyone had a drink from Starbucks.
author: Ginni S.

description: The barista working here was so nice and adorable. She was busy helping another customer, but very politely told me she would be with me soon. Joked with me a little, even though I was sleep and caffeine deprived. I would stop in again if I was in the area and needed a pick me up.
author: k h.

description: It's always really cold in here! I'm shivering in my peacoat.  I think this is a clever ploy to make us continually buy hot drinks.
author: Monika L.

description:
I went over to the Inner Sunset in hopes of finding a good place to plant my butt and work away on my laptop. I like lots of space and windows (for occasional people watching breaks) and most of the cafes in the area didn't meet this need so I settled for Starbucks.

I ordered a soy latte which was average. This place is huge and clean. There's plenty of tables to set up any workstation. However, there was one problem that day, wi-fi wasn't working. I left shortly after that.
author: Barney M.

description: This place gets really busy especially on the weekends! Reason to be patient here...great service with free smiles=D I was at dash cafe to try out their acclaimed coffee and to do some work and study but their service was so lousy I ended up back to the place I'm always usually at and I got my greentea latte (have been craving this since I got back from Japan) and I got to use my xmas gift card! I LOVE Starbucks;*
author: Neo23 T.

description: What can I really say...It's a Starbucks. Good place to study if you don't mind some San Francisco characters and the loud music. I went in to study and immediately saw a long line but it went away relatively quickly and then another line formed...so i waited...it went by pretty fast. I got a regular coffee black. they cant really mess up on that...but the cashier thanked me by my first name. he prob read it off my starbucks gold card.
author: Brendan L.

description: I like this starbucks for its ambiance, nice people, large space. It can get busy as the other reviews note, but if you don't come during the morning coffee rush, you'll find a nice quiet corner table tucked away where you may be able to get a tone of work done! It worked for me.
author: Mimi B.

description:
Why am I giving this place four stars?

It's clean.

It's friendly.

And I heard somewhere that Starbucks HAS to let anyone use the bathroom -- definitely a plus in my book!

Not to mention the fact that it's hosting a sickie like me as I wait for Adam to come kidnap me and take me to Milano for dinner!
author: Allison L.

description:
I'd have to agree with Shantangi...no line and my order was messed up. But I'm basing my review on the actual site. I really like this starbucks because they have tables placed along the wall with plenty of outlets. Oulets everywhere! Love it!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I wasn't very into Starbucks until they initiated the 50-cent refills for regular coffee, since I don't drink but a tiny bit before it's cold; so I'll get a small coffee that's half-full, and refill it every two hours or so that I remain nearby.  I liked that because I was paying about the same for the same amount of coffee, 2-3 dollars for venti-quantity in installments during a given day, without paying 1.50 per visit, which allowed me to drop that dollar in the tip jar instead, and produce less waste overall, which was a happy routine.  A couple weeks ago, though, one of the managers at this place started charging me full price for refills because I go to my office a block away instead of sitting in their always overcrowded, homeless-people-waiting-to-use-the-bathroom lounge.  So I don't go here anymore.
author: dule i.

description:
I live a few blocks away from here. They know my name and drink. I try to get to know them a little too..

If you're working from your laptop though, the wireless network here sucks. Keeps turning on and off for no reason.

Otherwise, it's part of my morning routine.
author: June C.

description:
It's Starbucks. No surprises here. Coffee that tastes as if the beans were burnt, not roasted. Lattes that are more like hot shake, not a coffee drink. But it will do in a pinch. 
 The tea is fine, not fantastic. At least they have honey for the tea (quite important for me) and sugar in the raw for the coffee. The people who work there are usually friendly and chatty, and never balk at serving me drinks when I walk in minutes to their closing time.
  Most importantly, it is open when most everything else near is closed. That is admittedly when I end up here. And it is a few steps away from the bus stop, and sitting inside with warm coffee beats shivering in the cold, foggy, San Francisco evening. The only thing that could please me more would be if they became 24 hours.
author: Miss Kae O.

description: By far the worst Starbucks in the city with the most incompetent crew who manages to get my order wrong or not at all almost every time.  Also, the "attitude" of the baristas are too much to bare ... are you kidding me?!?
author: S. I.

description:
the barista said to me, "why don't you look nice today?", with a dreamy smile and a flash of pearly whites.

5 STARS RIGHT THEN AND THERE.

(my white mocha wasn't too shabby either)

i am currently plotting my next outfit/hair/makeup/nails in anticipation of my next return.
author: sara n.

description:
First thing you have to ask yourself is "Why am I here?"  Are you here to get coffee, use the restroom, mooch off the wi-fi, or any combo of the three?  

Then, expect the following: 
- Coffee: Pretty standard Starbucks quality stuff. Custom-made to suit even the most fanatical coffee devotee's needs, on-point with whatever you need.
- Restroom: Scary, scary, scary. Also, frequently and notoriously used as a personal shower/number 7 depository. I would laugh, except I don't want to breath in the fumes. Unfortunately, you don't have much of a choice if you're stuck in the Sunset with a bladder the size of a peanut.  (Ask yourself, can you make it to the gleaming, but sometimes smelly bano at De Young?) 
- Wi-Fi: Excellent, if there aren't too many people with laptops around and you're not trying to watch any videos.  YouTube can wait.  
- All: Not bad. The service is awesome here, save for a few meanies.  Most of the SB peeps remember faces and are very open to making whatever crazy drink your inner-child desires. I'm thinking of my mint chocolate chip frap(extra coffee, extra cc chips) as we speak.

Lastly, enjoy.  This Starbucks may not be the Schultz' go-to archetype, but it certainly is cozy.  The remodel and the neighborhoody-ness of the SB peeps make you feel like you're in the title sequence of Cheers.  So... Cheers!
author: Daisy T.

description:
Ever wonder where happiness goes to die? Found it! This is the saddest Starbucks in the corporate-loving world. 
Starbuck's is my friend, though. In the ever-unstable world of coffee consumption, I always know what I'm getting at Starbucks. PLUS...they have a little thing called the LIGHT Frappuccino!!! This makes the world of bad-for-you deliciousness accessible to diet-obsessed folks like me. 
Back to this location...wow! Frowns abound and the cavernous interior beckons to your inner downer. I don't know what it is about this place that just makes me want to run screaming for the nearest sub-par mom and pop shop or Peet's. Maybe it's the homeless guy outside yelling at me about my "fancy shoes" or the trekkie hitting on me while I'm ordering. Or maybe it's the lady with five kids banging on the bathroom door as soon as I get in there. Maybe it's that they NEVER EVER have Christmas blend (my favorite). Even when it's (surprise!) Christmastime. Maybe it's their always-empty pastry case (even early a.m.). The staff are nice, but when I want a cookie, I want it!
author: Autumn K.

description: I love Starbucks coffee. I love Starbucks beans. I love Starbucks treats. I do not love Starbucks that have zero couches. I would spend way more time here if they had couches especially since this is my neighborhood. I am pissed I can't find any coffee houses/cafes with nice, big, comfy couches in inner sunset. Please get couches!!!
author: Snora E.

description: I went to this SB when they were having a promotion for their holiday drinks, buy one, get one.  So I ordered my husband's drink and then a peppermint mocha for me.  The guy tells me they ran out of peppermint, so I say okay, I'll have a regular mocha.  Then he rings me up, but doesn't give me the promotion.  I ask about it and he says that the computer will only do the special if he rings up a peppermint mocha.  So I suggest he do it that way, since I did try to order peppermint,  he says that would be against store policy, it would mess up their inventory!  Hello, it is a Saturday afternoon in December and you are out of peppermint.  Your inventory is already messed up.
author: Nicole J.

description: This is my local Starbucks, only within walking distance! I see the regular baristas, and a few new ones here and there. Overall I don't have a problem, but whenever new people make my drinks, they tend to suck. Pros about this Starbucks is that it's big, but most of the time there are barely any place to sit down to relax or study. If you have AT&T DSL, you can use your username and password and you'll be connected! That's what I like about this and other Starbucks!
author: Edgar G.

description: Starbucks is Starbucks is the people behind the counter. And I have one favorite employee here who is great. He is loud and silly and on one particular day he was talking about getting fired from his other job. And then he dropped a thing of milk and everyone was like, again!? hahaha. classic. He is great. The other employees all seem cool, too.
author: Jessica W.

description: Simple..never messed up my drink order, never had to wait more than like 4 minutes (tea frap tangerine thing), usually enough room to sit down and a lot of outlets for a laptop.
author: Nic K.

description: The Good: Decor is up to date. Drinks are adequate. Haven't been here in about 7 years though.
author: Keit K.

description: I go here  for the pastries...and the occasional venti coffee with toffee nut syrup. Other than that, I usually go across the street to the beanery.
author: James J.

description: Starbucks on 9th and Irving is the BEST! The staff is super and nice, but the best part, Free Newspapers, the NY Times and SF Chronicle. You don't pay! The best lattes and free newspapers.
author: smith m.
